snippet: International inspectors said they had verified the dismantling of 22 of 23 sites declared by Syrian authorities.
abstract: International chemical weapons inspectors report further progress in eliminating Syria's stockpile; say they have verified the destruction of 22 of the 23 sites that the Syrian government declared had been used for the production and mixing of the banned munitions.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: International inspectors said they had verified the dismantling of 22 of 23 sites declared by Syrian authorities.

headline.main: Inspectors in Syria Have Only One Site Left to Check
headline.print_headline: Inspectors In Syria Have Only One Site Left to Check
